title: Habits
text:
Python Code Example
Here’s an example of a Python code cell that creates a simple plot:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt import numpy as np x = np.linspace(0, 10, 100) y = np.sin(x)
plt.plot(x, y) plt.show()








Brunton, Steven L, Bernd R Noack, and Petros Koumoutsakos. 2020. “Machine Learning for Fluid Mechanics.” Annual Review of Fluid Mechanics 52 (1): 477–508.


Voulodimos, Athanasios, Nikolaos Doulamis, Anastasios Doulamis, and Eftychios Protopapadakis. 2018. “Deep Learning for Computer Vision: A Brief Review.” Computational Intelligence and Neuroscience 2018 (1): 7068349.

title: Habits
text:
Slide Title
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np

x = np.linspace(0, 10, 100)
y = np.sin(x)

plt.plot(x, y)
plt.title('Sine Wave')
plt.show()








Brunton, Steven L, Bernd R Noack, and Petros Koumoutsakos. 2020. “Machine Learning for Fluid Mechanics.” Annual Review of Fluid Mechanics 52 (1): 477–508.


Voulodimos, Athanasios, Nikolaos Doulamis, Anastasios Doulamis, and Eftychios Protopapadakis. 2018. “Deep Learning for Computer Vision: A Brief Review.” Computational Intelligence and Neuroscience 2018 (1): 7068349.
